title: Dependency vulnerability status unknown (npm audit unavailable in environment)

vulnerability_details.description: Unable to confirm whether dependencies contain known critical/high vulnerabilities because npm audit cannot run against the configured registry in this environment.
vulnerability_details.exploitation: If vulnerable transitive packages exist (e.g., SSRF, prototype pollution, ReDoS), they may be exploitable depending on runtime exposure.
vulnerability_details.impact: Potential compromise depending on affected package and usage.

steps: Run `npm audit` in your normal dev environment (or GitHub Actions) against the same lockfile.
Supplement with `pnpm audit`/Snyk/Dependabot alerts and enforce a CI gate for critical/high findings.
Document and timebox any exceptions with compensating controls.
verification: CI job: run npm audit (or Snyk) and fail on critical/high.
Confirm Dependabot alerts are enabled and triaged.

evidence: npm audit returned: "Repo npm-public does not support npm audit" (environment limitation)
notes: Not a code defect; it's an evidence limitation that must be resolved externally.
